issue.title: adding scan-build test
issue.body:
Fixes #1239. Avoid recurrence of #1212 ~(which arguably should be re-opened)~.

@dstebila : Please decide how/when to merge this. My suggestion would be after @sebastinas and @bhess had a chance to review the [run log](https://circleci.com/api/v1.1/project/github/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/17515/output/103/0?file=true&allocation-id=62bb17df947e861ada3206ce-0-build%2F54D6229E) for the picnic and kyber issues listed.

* [no] Does this PR change the input/output behaviour of a cryptographic algorithm (i.e., does it change known answer test values)?  (If so, a version bump will be required from *x.y.z* to *x.(y+1).0*.)
* [no] Does this PR change the the list of algorithms available -- either adding, removing, or renaming?  (If so, PRs in OQS-OpenSSL, OQS-BoringSSL, and OQS-OpenSSH will also be required by the time this is merged.)

issue.title: adding scan-build test
issue.body:
Fixes #1239. Avoid recurrence of #1212 ~(which arguably should be re-opened)~.

@dstebila : Please decide how/when to merge this. My suggestion would be after @sebastinas and @bhess had a chance to review the [run log](https://circleci.com/api/v1.1/project/github/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/17515/output/103/0?file=true&allocation-id=62bb17df947e861ada3206ce-0-build%2F54D6229E) for the picnic and kyber issues listed.

* [no] Does this PR change the input/output behaviour of a cryptographic algorithm (i.e., does it change known answer test values)?  (If so, a version bump will be required from *x.y.z* to *x.(y+1).0*.)
* [no] Does this PR change the the list of algorithms available -- either adding, removing, or renaming?  (If so, PRs in OQS-OpenSSL, OQS-BoringSSL, and OQS-OpenSSH will also be required by the time this is merged.)

comment.body:
> In order to make headway this PR now excludes Kyber from the test. Suggest to update this exclusion as and when this gets fixed upstream and merged to liboqs (didn't find issue to link to in either [PQClean](https://github.com/PQClean/PQClean/issues) or [PQCrystals](https://github.com/pq-crystals/kyber/issues)).

Sounds good. Will update Kyber once the PR in pqcrystals is merged, see https://github.com/pq-crystals/kyber/pull/47.

issue.title: adding memory leak testing
issue.body:
Fixes #1213 -- excluding "Classic-McEliece-8192128" as it fails the memory leak test. Open to suggestions how to otherwise handle / document this failure: Draft PR until then.

* [no] Does this PR change the input/output behaviour of a cryptographic algorithm (i.e., does it change known answer test values)?  (If so, a version bump will be required from *x.y.z* to *x.(y+1).0*.)
* [no] Does this PR change the the list of algorithms available -- either adding, removing, or renaming?  (If so, PRs in OQS-OpenSSL, OQS-BoringSSL, and OQS-OpenSSH will also be required by the time this is merged.)

comment.body:
> @bhess: The new valgrind mem_leak tests fail on ppc64 and s390 as they exceed the maximum test execution time allotted on Travis. What's your preference to resolve this for these IBM platforms: a) skip memory leak testing ? b) skip testing some algorithms not interesting on those platforms? c) move testing to an environment allowing for more test run-time than Travis?
> 
> My preference is a) as it's easiest to implement. But then again b) also is trivial -- only someone has to select the "losers" to drop :-)

Agreed with preference a), and then b) when the selection is made any day :)

issue.title: adding memory leak testing
issue.body:
Fixes #1213 -- excluding "Classic-McEliece-8192128" as it fails the memory leak test. Open to suggestions how to otherwise handle / document this failure: Draft PR until then.

* [no] Does this PR change the input/output behaviour of a cryptographic algorithm (i.e., does it change known answer test values)?  (If so, a version bump will be required from *x.y.z* to *x.(y+1).0*.)
* [no] Does this PR change the the list of algorithms available -- either adding, removing, or renaming?  (If so, PRs in OQS-OpenSSL, OQS-BoringSSL, and OQS-OpenSSH will also be required by the time this is merged.)

comment.body:
> Agreed with preference a)

Implemented in https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/pull/1234/commits/73b44c5d9e77174803c839c84a5446486ee3e33a. Only little thing remaining: Why does CI VM behave differently than my local machine(s)....

issue.title: Add non-PQ as a baseline
issue.body: It would be useful to have performance numbers for non-PQ algorithms as a baseline comparison. This is present in some of the profiling operations but not all (e.g., handshake performance).  This would include both non-PQ key exchange and non-PQ signatures.

comment.body: Hmm -- please take a look at https://openquantumsafe.org/benchmarking/visualization/openssl_speed.html

issue.title: Add non-PQ as a baseline
issue.body: It would be useful to have performance numbers for non-PQ algorithms as a baseline comparison. This is present in some of the profiling operations but not all (e.g., handshake performance).  This would include both non-PQ key exchange and non-PQ signatures.

comment.body:
Scrolling down the tables gives you for example this: 

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/57787676/176647809-a2721d47-2263-4af8-a5b9-72881806f5f5.png)

Algorithm names are shown when hovering the pointer over the bar(s). Grey algorithms are "classic", colored ones are QS algs...

issue.title: Add non-PQ as a baseline
issue.body: It would be useful to have performance numbers for non-PQ algorithms as a baseline comparison. This is present in some of the profiling operations but not all (e.g., handshake performance).  This would include both non-PQ key exchange and non-PQ signatures.

comment.body: Right, they're present in our results for KEM/SIG OpenSSL performance (openssl speed) results, but not in our [TLS handshake performance (openssl s_time)](https://openquantumsafe.org/benchmarking/visualization/handshakes.html) results.

issue.title: scan-build errors

labels.name: future-work
labels.description: Will not be fixed in current release cycle

issue.body:
Hey,
I have just runned `scan-build` from `clang` via `scan-build -analyze-headers --use-cc /usr/bin/clang --use-c++ /usr/bin/clang++ make -j4`, it found a few errors and I thought it may interests you.
This includes:
 -  2 double free
 -  1 memory leak
 -  2 dead assignments

![capture du 2017-11-23 15-27-32](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10683430/33177435-df5f98ac-d062-11e7-9af9-fce09bf49b67.png)

issue.title: Stack overflow on some tests
issue.body:
MacOS Monterey 12.4, Xcode-13.4.1.

```

rustc 1.61.0
binary: rustc

```

Also, if I already have `liboqs` built and installed - is there any way to use it, instead of rebuilding liboqs within this package?
```

comment.body:
Idea is good. But
```
$ export RUSTFLAGS="-C link-args=-Wl,-stack_size,0x80000000 target-feature=+aes,+ssse3,+sse4.1,+sse4.2,+avx2,+pclmulqdq,+rdrand -L/opt/local/lib/liconv -liconv -L/opt/local/lib -lz -lssl -lcrypto -L/Users/ur20980/lib"
$ cargo test
error: failed to run `rustc` to learn about target-specific information

Caused by:
  process didn't exit successfully: `rustc - --crate-name ___ --print=file-names -C link-args=-Wl,-stack_size,0x80000000 target-feature=+aes,+ssse3,+sse4.1,+sse4.2,+avx2,+pclmulqdq,+rdrand -L/opt/local/lib/liconv -liconv -L/opt/local/lib -lz -lssl -lcrypto -L/Users/ur20980/lib --crate-type bin --crate-type rlib --crate-type dylib --crate-type cdylib --crate-type staticlib --crate-type proc-macro --print=sysroot --print=cfg` (exit status: 1)
  --- stderr
  error: multiple input filenames provided (first two filenames are `-` and `target-feature=+aes,+ssse3,+sse4.1,+sse4.2,+avx2,+pclmulqdq,+rdrand`)

$ 
```

comment.body:
### Update 2
Now, after more struggling with how to pass these flags through Cargo, it compiles - but exhibits the same (?) stack overflow problem:
```
